file_content.text: My... wound is mortal, Sith. At least I die knowing you'll never find Jaesa....
My lord, Darth Baras sent us in case you... needed... help. Clearly, that's not the case.
He said Nomen Karr should be kept alive. May we stabilize him?
No! Baras be damned! I want... to die. Then Jaesa will be safe....
My master's orders will not be ignored.
Baras must be obeyed.
I'm not done, Karr. You will suffer as no one has ever suffered.
Not death. Torture, first.
May the Force... protect... me....
Despite what you think, I'm not trying to kill your Padawan.
I mean Jaesa no harm.
Lies... tricks....
We'll save him, my lord, and then be out of your way in an adjacent chamber. Hurry, men, the Jedi's fading!
Yeaahhhh! T--torture me all you like, Sith! The pain only fills me with more hate. More rage!
You--I--I'm going to kill you! You and your pathetic master are dead! Do you hear me, dead!
How delightful to hear you spew such venomous thoughts, Jedi. Please, continue.
At last you show yourself.
Your smugness is an insult! You're not my better. Unbind me so I can rip you limb from limb!
It's not personal. I'm only doing what I must to draw your Padawan out.
This was never about you.
You'll never have her! She's far from here and that's where she'll stay!
Calm yourself, Jedi. Try to find the tranquility beyond the pain.
Remember your training.
Tranquility be damned! Unbind me and see my true power. I'll rip you limb from limb!
My lord, the Padawan has arrived. She looks rather unnerved.
Hey, she's here--man, she looks mad.
Stay out of the way and let me handle this.
Give her room.
Now we'll see what she's really made of.
Good, I want her raw.
Her power should not be taken lightly.
Be on guard.
Sith! Your men outside let me pass, so I assume I'm expected. Cease your sadistic attacks on my Master. Now!
W--what? I... I live? No. No! Baras's plan cannot succeed.
I... I'm alive. I see through you, Sith. You only saved me so that Jaesa would believe your heart is pure.
I will not be the bait that draws Jaesa to you!
You have no choice.
Too bad.
This is not fair. I dedicated my life to destroying Baras! Sacrificed everything!
It gives me such pleasure to hear your despair.
Keep crying, Jedi.
Do not laugh at my expense, Sith! You and your master are nothing!
Jaesa is beyond your reach. She will still expose the truth. So keep me alive--I want to be around when you fall!
There's no reason for you to become so distraught.
Calm yourself, Master Karr.
I was supposed to expose Baras and open the Jedi Council's eyes. It was my destiny!
Jaesa is mine! The glory of defeating Baras is mine!
My lord, the Padawan approaches.
Hey, lookie-lookie, Jaesa showed up.
Make room for our guest of honor.
Then step aside.
Excellent. My triumph is at hand.
The lamb to the slaughter.
Her power is considerable.
Stand ready, then.
Sith, I have come. It seems I was expected--your men outside let me pass.
Release Master Karr; your efforts to draw me out have been a success.
Jaesa, no! I told you to stay put! How dare you defy me!
Witness now, the utter destruction of all your hopes and plans.
Suffer, old man.
Jaesa's destiny lies with me, old man.
She is mine.
I have long been waiting for this moment.
At last. Welcome.
My sacrifice for nothing! Stupid child, for all your power, you have understood nothing!
What have you... done to him, Sith? Has this been inside him all along?
No, it can't be. No one can hide such darkness. Somehow you've turned him mad.
I only exposed what was lurking inside.
This is the real Master Karr.
Is that what you call what you have been doing?
Look into your Master's heart and see the truth.
Use your power on him.
Master Karr taught me not to use my power as a crutch, only when it was clearly necessary.
I have never brought it to bear on him. But....
I... I sense... pride and... envy and hate... and vengeance. No! What Sith trick is this? I... I would have known if such darkness resided within him!
Just admit when you're wrong and move on.
Stop crying.
Move on to what? I....
It's thrilling to watch your whole world crumble.
Your pain is delightful.
I'm not here for your amusement, Sith.
That is what the Jedi do. They mask and pretend and hide.
It's not your fault.
I... I thought I'd found something I could count on.
Jedi are... pure. You're supposed to know where you stand with them. Right?
Jaesa, it's all a trick! Turn your power on the Sith, and you'll see!
What are you going to do about it, Padawan?
Yeah. So what?
I've come to put an end to this conflict.
You killed Master Yonlach and my... my parents. Now you've twisted my Master into some abomination.
I felt every torturous moment you put him through, and it must end now!
You were being deceived. I revealed the truth.
I did this to help you.
I didn't ask for your help.
I'll make it so you feel nothing, girl.
Come meet your doom. [Attack]
No doubt now that you've lured me to you, your plan is to kill him. I will not let that happen.
You spared Master Yonlach on Tatooine and my parents on Alderaan.
Your mercy reached out to me, then--but now you torture my Master. I don't understand.
People don't always fall into simple categories.
Everyone is gray.
I had to show you the truth about your Master.
This was necessary.
It's not for you to understand, Padawan.
Tough luck.
Now... I felt Master Karr slipping toward death, but you... you saved him.
Your actions belie your station. Is it real or has it all been a trick to get me to lower my guard?
I'm not what you've been led to believe, Jaesa.
It's no trick.
The restraint has been sheer torture. I did it to fool you.
It was all a ploy.
I see. Finally, some honesty.
Since your ruse has achieved its purpose, I suspect you intend to kill my Master. I cannot allow that.
I am confused by you, Sith. Your actions with my parents on Alderaan and Master Yonlach on Tatooine paint different pictures.
To show such mercy with one but cruelty with the other. You are an enigma.
But now you torment me by sadistically torturing my Master. Obviously, you mean to kill him. I cannot allow that.
And when I felt my Master slipping toward death... you saved him. Who are you?
I thought you could sense the true nature of any being.
Aren't you all-seeing?
I am chaos. I live in the moment and act on my whims.
There's no rhyme or reason.
The inconsistency of my actions has been designed to confuse you.
It was all deliberate.
Use your power, Jaesa! Look into the Sith's heart, and you will see!
Look at me as long as you like--I have nothing to hide.
I welcome it.
Indeed, let me experience this power of yours firsthand.
Fascinating idea.
Very well, then....
Arrr, so... dark. You are awash in vices and cruelty. Anger and greed and... malevolence drive your emotions. It is too much to bear!
I told you, foolish child! The Sith spared your parents and Master Yonlach only to trick you!
I told you, foolish child! The fates of your parents and Master Yonlach should have been proof enough!
Foolish child, the Sith are not a puzzle; they are the embodiment of darkness.
I'm sorry, Master. I've wandered into a terrible trap. I will do whatever I can to stop this Sith and save you.
I see... mercy... and fairness and... even perhaps compassion. You have walked the light path.
Sparing Master Yonlach and my parents are true reflections of you, but it is said that Sith embody darkness. How is this possible?
Let it be a lesson--you must never presume anything.
Learn from this.
To walk among Sith and not be discovered is an incredible challenge.
It hasn't been easy.
But how can this be? You destroyed Master Yonlach and my parents.
If I spared your people, the Sith I serve would realize the truth about me. I am sorry.
Unfortunate necessities.
They did not believe my intentions and attacked with deadly force.
[Lie] I was defending myself.
This is... not what I expected. Your treatment of my people has been chaotic. You're Sith. You embody darkness. How can you be light?
Nothing is black and white. Everything is unknowable.
Learn to embrace uncertainty.
So, although you reflect the light, it does not determine your future actions....
There is so little you understand, Padawan.
You know nothing.
The Sith have been slandered for centuries.
Jedi propaganda.
Don't listen, Jaesa! It's all a trick. The Sith has disguised himself and me to cause you to doubt your power!
I--I don't know what to believe. You told me there was order to the galaxy--that you would show me the truth!
But nothing is true! Both of you are trying to drive me insane!
It's Darth Baras! He is manipulating us all. Kill the Sith! Kill Baras's liar and you'll see!
The truth is plainly before you. I walk in the light.
I am not your enemy, Jaesa.
Shut up! I can't trust you! I can't trust anything!
You must do what you believe is right.
Trust your feelings, Jaesa.
Don't tell me what I must do! I no longer believe in anything!
Strike me down, if you can.
Go ahead and try.
Nothing makes sense anymore!
There is great contradiction within you. I see darkness--greed, anger--but... there is light as well--mercy... justice....
Your intentions are... not knowable.
I cannot be summed up, child.
That's right.
Then I will never know where I stand with you. You leave me no choice but to engage.
If you want to learn something about me, just ask.
Get to know me.
No, I could never be certain of the answer. You leave me no choice but to engage.
You sound scared, and you should be.
It's unnerving, isn't it?
I see the only way to end this madness is to defeat you.
Try it and I'll be forced to destroy you.
Don't you dare.
Then it seems keeping my Master alive was a ploy to lure me out.
Now that you have succeeded, I can only assume that you mean to kill Master Karr. And I will not permit that.
Stop me. Lash out and strike me down.
Release your anger, then.
No, I... is this more trickery? Do not... taunt me, Sith.... I will not be played with!
Prove you are right--destroy me. There is no other way. If not, you and your Master die here.
Lash out at me, Jaesa.
For all your special powers, you're as blind as everyone else.
You see nothing.
You are a truly laughable sight.
How pathetic.
I've warned you....
Wait... what have I done? Jaesa, no....
Prepare to die, Sith!
Time to find out what you're made of.
Come at me, then.
May the Force give me the power to subdue you.
Join me, and Master Karr doesn't have to die.
Surrender and I'll spare him.
I will not join you. To place such a condition on murder is repulsive.
Yes! Strike now, Jaesa! Take the Sith down!
Defend yourself, Sith!
You can't stop me if you're dead!
Worry about yourself. [Attack]
No! This is not right! Fall! You must fall to me!
I fall to no one!
You're weakening, Karr. Surrender.
I never do what I'm supposed to do.
Silence, Sith!
Ahh! The Force is... very strong with you. I... must dig deeper.
Release your anger! It's the only way to defeat me!
Stand down, Karr. No one has to die.
Never.
You're digging your own grave, Jedi.
Your presence tells me that my fellows Ulldin and Zylixx must have failed. Pity.
I should have known Baras couldn't be trusted. As a man of my word--I'm here, alone, as agreed.
Your master shows himself a coward, sending you in his stead.
He sends me to do all his killing.
It's my job.
You are young in the Force, a mere apprentice. I'm a full Jedi Master.
It hardly seems fair for you.
Yes, you're outmatched.
What's your point?
So?
For all his bravado, your master's actions expose the flaws of the dark side--and your flaws for following him.
Reaching beyond one's grasp leads to greatness.
I hope I'm up to the task.
Or to death.
You sound upset, Master Karr. Angry, even.
We've gotten under your skin.
Your crusade has affected me, Sith. I'm not blind to that. But I've wandered the line between the dark and the light before.
I walked among your master and the Sith. My connection to the light survived them, and it shall survive you.
That was Baras; I'm completely different.
You're going to fail.
So, you can succeed where your master failed?
I'm curious about your history. What exactly happened between you?
Tell me about you and Baras.
There isn't time for reminiscing. Whatever adulterated version your master told you will have to suffice.
You can't fool me--your connection to the light is sputtering.
You're already in the dark.
I find your disruptions... unnerving, but don't flatter yourself.
I have no choice but to put an end to you. And then all will become calm again.
I mean you no harm.
No, I'm sure you're here to play pazaak.
You are Baras's pawn--an especially resourceful and powerful one, but still only that. I must put an end to you.
Once you are out of the way, Jaesa will provide the proof I need to open the Jedi Council's eyes and expose Baras's network of spies.
Come, Karr, let us embrace death and settle this once and for all.
It's time to fight. [Attack]
You mean that network that you invented in your head.
[Lie] There are no spies.
I'll waste no more time with lies.
Don't force me to destroy you.
Please reconsider.
This ends now, Sith.
It seems Darth Baras has found himself a singularly vicious weapon in you.
This experience has given me valuable insight. I'll be prepared for you next time, Sith.
I'll wait right here, Karr. Come and face me now.
Why put it off?
Jedi do not seek out a fight.
I was holding back. I fought them with one eye closed.
This told you nothing.
You cannot get under my skin with your antics.
No one else has to die. We can discuss this peacefully, Master Karr.
I do not wish more bloodshed.
If only that were true.
My place is by my Padawan's side, teaching her the ways of the Force and honing her talents.
I will do everything in my power to keep her hidden from you.
You do that.
You won't last long.
You have chosen this path, Karr, and placed us at odds.
It didn't have to be this way.
Your embrace of the dark side and service to Darth Baras determined our relationship long before this moment.
Until we meet again.
--seems to be the trouble, Hirosho? Tell me why you're so concerned.
Master Karr, you promised we would be undetected, but the ship we've been tracking for you is here!
Calm your fear, Hirosho; it will not serve you. I will speak with your visitor when the time comes.
The time is upon you. I am here, say your piece.
Speak, then.
Expect the conversation to be short, Jedi.
Talk is cheap.
The fear I inspire cannot be suppressed, Jedi.
Let them sweat.
Uh... okay... you never told me we'd be tracking a Sith....
You were provided the details necessary to perform your duties. Now, please remain quiet.
Sith. I presume you are Darth Baras's new apprentice. I am Jedi Master Nomen Karr. Do you know me?
You're my master's sworn enemy.
I know you.
Will you be disappointed if I don't?
Should I?
I have a long history with your master.
All you Jedi look alike to me--soon to be deceased.
Doesn't matter.
You have your master's disposition, I see.
Baras and I like to keep tabs on each other. So when I heard of a new apprentice, I investigated.
These men were merely monitoring the equipment. Following orders. There's no need for bloodshed here.
I do not bleed my enemies out of need, Jedi. I enjoy it.
Bloodshed is fun.
How sobering. Getting this firsthand look at you tells me much.
I see no need for further pretense. Let's speak frankly.
My quarrel is with you, Jedi. These men need not suffer.
They are free to go.
Your temperance is remarkable.
Hirosho, please leave with your men immediately.
Thank you. Thank you, Master Karr. And... you as well... Sith.
Go.
Of course.
I might change my mind.
Now that they are safe, I'll speak plainly.
I know Baras has spies, and I know you were sent to extract two of them before they could be exposed.
But I'll soon have the proof I need. Baras's spies can't hide for long.
There's no proof to get, Karr. You're deluded.
[Lie] Baras has no spies.
Don't waste your breath with lies.
I feel an overwhelming need for bloodshed!
I disagree. [Kill Hirosho]
Hirosho, defend yourself! The Sith attacks!
What an... excessive display. Those men were defenseless and unarmed.
Their deaths are on your head, Karr.
It's your fault.
Such a sad attempt to deflect responsibility, Sith.
Being unarmed may have been a poor choice.
And they paid for it.
That was the difference in the fight.
But I wasn't.
You are every bit your master's minion.
I shall honor Hirosho and his men's lives by dedicating myself to thwarting you and your master.
You must do what you must do.
Whatever.
I'm sure they feel better about dying now.
Does them no good.
Make all the snide comments you like, Sith. There is much you don't know.
You will fail, and they will have died for nothing.
Then it was meaningless.
Your confidence is unfounded. Soon you will realize that.
It calms me that you and Baras have no idea what you're up against.
Call off your vendetta and I'll spare your life.
Save yourself and give it up.
Jedi do not succumb to vendettas. That is for your kind.
Stay calm, Jedi. Relax all you like.
Keep telling yourself that.
The Force is strongest in the quiet eye of the storm. You Sith fail to understand that.
Your sudden attack on Hirosho and his men caught me by surprise. But I've been prepared for the possibility of my operation being discovered....
These troopers are among the Republic's best. Go with them peacefully, and the Jedi Council will take that into consideration.
Your pupil's powers are a sham. She is leading you on a witch hunt.
We know about your Padawan.
Ah. You know more than I thought. Baras no doubt is after my Padawan. How unfortunate.
I've kept her identity and location a secret. So, you and your master are just feeling your way in the dark.
But my Padawan is of supreme importance to me and the Jedi Order. I will not let harm come to her.
I would expect nothing less.
Knock yourself out, Jedi.
In that case, I shall exceed your expectations, my friend.
I mean her no harm, Master Karr.
I have peaceful intentions.
Please excuse me if I don't believe you.
I'm going to keep her skull as a trophy.
She will die a gruesome death.
Clearly, there's no reasoning with you.
You're about to find out how resourceful I can be.
Forgive the earlier deception, Sith, but now that Hirosho and his men have escaped harm, I must neutralize you immediately.
Hirosho, let me show you why there was no cause for concern.
These troopers are among the Republic's finest. Surrender, and the Jedi Council will be lenient.
Then you leave me no choice. Men, take this Sith in, by any means necessary.
Stand ready, men, the Sith attacks!
You've got to be kidding.
This is making things worse.
Never! [Attack]
